body: \text{Determine whether each of the following relations are reflexive, symmetric, and transitive: } R = \{(x, y) : 3x - y = 0\} \text{ in the set } A = \{1, 2, 3, ..., 14\}.
\text{Let } R \text{ be a relation on the set of all triangles defined by } R = \{(T_1, T_2) : T_1 \text{ is congruent to } T_2\}. \text{ Show that } R \text{ is an equivalence relation.}
\text{In the set } Z \text{ of integers, let } R = \{(a, b) : 2 \text{ divides } (a - b)\}. \text{ Prove that } R \text{ is an equivalence relation.}
\text{Check whether the relation } R \text{ defined in the set } \{1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6\} \text{ as } R = \{(a, b) : b = a + 1\} \text{ is reflexive, symmetric, or transitive.}

\text{Let } R \text{ be the relation in the set of points in a plane given by } R = \{(P, Q) : \text{distance of } P \text{ from origin is the same as the distance of } Q \text{ from origin}\}. \text{ Show that } R \text{ is an equivalence relation.}
\text{Evaluate } \sin^{-1}\left(\frac{1}{2}\right) + \cos^{-1}\left(\frac{1}{2}\right).
\text{Prove that } \tan^{-1} (x) + \tan^{-1} (y) = \tan^{-1} \left(\frac{x + y}{1 - xy}\right), \text{ for } x y < 1.
\text{Find the value of } \cot^{-1} (\cot x) \text{ when } x \text{ lies in the interval } \left(0, \pi\right).
\text{If } \sin^{-1} (x) + \sin^{-1} (y) = \frac{\pi}{2}, \text{ then show that } x^2 + y^2 = 1.
\text{Find the principal value of } \cos^{-1}\left(-\frac{1}{2}\right).
\text{If } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix} \text{ and } B = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 0 \\ 1 & 3 \end{bmatrix}, \text{ find } AB \text{ and } BA.
\text{Prove that the matrix } \begin{bmatrix} \cos \theta & -\sin \theta \\ \sin \theta & \cos \theta \end{bmatrix} \text{ is orthogonal.}
\text{If } A \text{ is a square matrix such that } A^2 = I, \text{ then show that either } A = I \text{ or } A = -I.
\text{Let } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & -1 \\ 2 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 & 1 \end{bmatrix}. \text{ Find the transpose of } A.
\text{Show that } \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & -1 & 4 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix} \text{ is an upper triangular matrix.}
\text{If } A = \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{vmatrix}, \text{ find the determinant of } A.
\text{Prove that the determinant of a skew-symmetric matrix of odd order is zero.}
\text{Find the area of the triangle with vertices at } (1, 2), (3, 4), (5, 6) \text{ using determinants.}
\text{If } A \text{ is a } 3 \times 3 \text{ matrix and } |A| = 5, \text{ find the value of } |5A|.
\text{Solve for } x \text{ if } \begin{vmatrix} x & 1 \\ 2 & x \end{vmatrix} = 0.
\text{Check the continuity of } f(x) = \begin{cases} x^2 & \text{if } x < 2 \\ 4x - 3 & \text{if } x \geq 2 \end{cases} \text{ at } x = 2.
\text{Find the derivative of } f(x) = \sin(x^2) \text{ with respect to } x.
\text{If } f(x) = |x - 3|, \text{ check if } f \text{ is differentiable at } x = 3.
\text{Evaluate } \lim_{x \to 0} \frac{\sin x}{x}.
\text{Using the concept of differentiability, prove that if } f(x) = x^3, \text{ then } f'(0) = 0.
\text{Find the equation of the tangent to the curve } y = x^2 + 3x - 5 \text{ at the point where } x = 1.
\text{Determine the intervals on which the function } f(x) = x^3 - 3x^2 + 4 \text{ is increasing or decreasing.}
\text{Using derivatives, find the maximum and minimum values of } f(x) = x^2 - 4x + 3 \text{ on } [0, 3].
\text{A particle moves along a curve such that its position at time } t \text{ is given by } s(t) = 4t^3 - 3t^2 + 2t. \text{ Find its velocity at } t = 2.
\text{Find the rate of change of the area of a circle with respect to its radius } r \text{ when } r = 5.
\text{Evaluate } \int \frac{x^3}{\sqrt{1 - x^2}} \, dx.
\text{Find } \int \frac{1}{x \ln x} \, dx.
\text{Evaluate } \int e^x \sin x \, dx.
\text{Using integration by parts, evaluate } \int x \cos x \, dx.
\text{Evaluate the integral } \int_{0}^{\pi/2} \sin^2 x \, dx.
\text{Find the area bounded by the curve } y = x^2 \text{ and the line } y = 4.
\text{Calculate the area under the curve } y = \sqrt{x} \text{ between } x = 0 \text{ and } x = 4.
\text{Find the area between the curves } y = x^2 \text{ and } y = x + 2.
\text{Determine the area bounded by the parabola } y = x^2 \text{ and the line } y = 2x + 3.
\text{Evaluate the area enclosed by the curves } y = \sin x \text{ and } y = \cos x \text{ from } x = 0 \text{ to } x = \frac{\pi}{4}.
\text{Solve the differential equation } \frac{dy}{dx} = \frac{y}{x + y}.
\text{Find the general solution of } \frac{d^2y}{dx^2} + y = 0.
\text{Solve the initial value problem } \frac{dy}{dx} = y \text{ with } y(0) = 1.
\text{Determine the particular solution of } \frac{dy}{dx} = x + y \text{ given that } y(0) = 2.
\text{Solve the differential equation } \frac{dy}{dx} = e^{x+y}.
\text{Find the magnitude of the vector } \vec{a} = 3\hat{i} + 4\hat{j} - \hat{k}.
\text{If } \vec{a} = 2\hat{i} - \hat{j} + 3\hat{k} \text{ and } \vec{b} = -\hat{i} + 4\hat{j} + 2\hat{k}, \text{ find } \vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}.
\text{Find a unit vector in the direction of } \vec{c} = 5\hat{i} - 12\hat{j}.
\text{Determine the angle between the vectors } \vec{u} = \hat{i} + 2\hat{j} \text{ and } \vec{v} = 2\hat{i} + 4\hat{j}.
\text{If } \vec{a} = 3\hat{i} - \hat{j} + \hat{k} \text{ and } \vec{b} = 2\hat{i} + 2\hat{j} - 4\hat{k}, \text{ find } \vec{a} \times \vec{b}.
\text{Find the distance between the points } (1, 2, 3) \text{ and } (4, 5, 6).
\text{Find the equation of the line passing through the points } (1, -2, 3) \text{ and } (4, 0, -1).
\text{Find the angle between the lines } \frac{x - 1}{2} = \frac{y + 3}{4} = \frac{z}{3} \text{ and } \frac{x + 2}{1} = \frac{y - 1}{2} = \frac{z + 3}{-2}.
\text{Find the shortest distance between the skew lines } \frac{x - 1}{2} = \frac{y + 1}{-1} = \frac{z}{1} \text{ and } \frac{x}{1} = \frac{y - 2}{2} = \frac{z + 3}{3}.
\text{Determine the coordinates of the point where the line } \frac{x - 2}{3} = \frac{y + 1}{-4} = \frac{z - 3}{5} \text{ intersects the plane } x + y + z = 9.

\text{A manufacturer produces two products } A \text{ and } B \text{ that require 4 hours and 6 hours respectively for assembly. Each product also requires 3 hours for packaging. The maximum assembly hours available are 60, and the maximum packaging hours available are 24. Formulate this as a linear programming problem to maximize profit if the profit is } \text{Rs. 10 for } A \text{ and Rs. 15 for } B.
\text{Solve the linear programming problem: Maximize } Z = 5x + 3y, \text{ subject to } x + 2y \leq 20, \text{ and } 3x + y \leq 30, \text{ where } x, y \geq 0.

\text{A dietitian wishes to mix two types of foods in such a way that vitamin content in the mixture contains at least 8 units of vitamin A and 10 units of vitamin B. Type I food contains 2 units of vitamin A and 1 unit of vitamin B per kg. Type II food contains 1 unit of vitamin A and 2 units of vitamin B per kg. The cost of type I food is } \text{Rs. 50 per kg and the cost of type II food is Rs. 60 per kg. Formulate a linear programming problem to minimize the cost of the mixture.}
\text{Solve the linear programming problem: Minimize } Z = 4x + 6y, \text{ subject to } x + y \geq 5, \; 2x + y \geq 10, \; x, y \geq 0.

\text{A factory manufactures two types of products } P \text{ and } Q. \text{ Each product } P \text{ requires 2 hours for assembling and 1 hour for finishing, while each product } Q \text{ requires 1 hour for assembling and 3 hours for finishing. The maximum time available for assembling is 10 hours and for finishing is 12 hours. Formulate this problem to maximize the number of units produced.}
\text{If a coin is tossed 5 times, what is the probability of getting exactly 3 heads?}
\text{A and B play a game of tennis. If the probability of A winning a game is } \frac{3}{5} \text{, find the probability that A wins at least 2 games out of 3.}

\text{In a class of 20 students, the probability that a student is left-handed is } \frac{1}{5}. \text{ If 4 students are selected at random, what is the probability that exactly 1 of them is left-handed?}
\text{Two dice are thrown. Find the probability of getting a sum of 7 or 11.}
\text{If a bag contains 5 red balls, 3 blue balls, and 2 green balls, what is the probability that a randomly drawn ball is either red or green?}
